S.FORM: pashtay maqitan piakalingkin piakaimahan. iza araiza ita.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，大家平安。我們開始了。
Good day, everyone. Here we go.

S.FORM: ilhilhiwan! pashungkitaz!
maqitan shinshii.
ilhungquiza.
pashtay maqitan piakalingkin piakaimahan. thuini shinshii apishfazaq pashtay maniun kmuza sa akaanin a Thau a lalawa.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，平安。今天老師要教大家食物的邵語怎麼說。
Hello, everyone, peace. Today, I am going to teach you how to say Shao for food.

S.FORM: mafazaq ihu shinshii a lalawa?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: shinshii, maura iaku. shduu ihu qa uqthawan malhinuna?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: ani iaku tunmaza, shduu ihu piara’inin lalawa?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: riqazuan uhu inai! uqtha untal iakin malhinuna mutal.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: mathuaw tauduu.
uqthawan malhinuna. piara’inin mihu a lalawa.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: irarauriuquan. ata tu palhinuna.
pu’apawan sa patashan.
ua, shinshii.
pu’apawan sa patatash.
shinshii, min’aura iaku kmathu patatash.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: pu’apawan sa tatitish.
shinshii, min’aura iaku kmathu tatitish.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: shimuluan uhu tatitish mihu a shirshir a tataal lhmupish a huruy.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: shduu mihu a tatitish ya shimulikuan?
pangqaiza malhupish ita.
pananaiza lhmupish, uqthwan mapariqaz ya simaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這裡，明天再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: tima ihu?
Liwan iaku.
tima ihu?
Huqu a azazak iaku, zain Liwan.
S.TRANSL: I am Shuhut's son, and my name is Quan.

S.FORM: tima ihu?
iaku sa Qaba wa lhupilhupishan a azazak, zain Liwan.
S.TRANSL: I am a student in Shuhut, my name is Quan.

S.FORM: kuzan mihu a lhanaz?
naak a lhanaz zain Liwan.
kuzan mihu a ama wa lhanaz?
naak a ama wa lhanaz zain Huqu.
tima thithu?
Shulay thithu
naak a tantuqash ayuzi a minlhafut thithu, zain Shulay.
S.TRANSL: He's my brother, his name is Taniwu.

S.FORM: kuzan thithu a lhanaz?
thithu a lhanaz zain Shulay.
thithu a lhanaz zain Huqu qa?
ua, thithu a lhanaz zain Huqu.
thithu a lhanaz zain Qaba qa?
ani, thithu a lhanaz zain Shulay.
tima huya wa thau?
Apin thithu. naak a pan’inaan thithu.
tima huya wa thau?
naak a huruy thithu, thithu a lhanaz zain Ishuz.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Ishuz。
She is my friend, her name is Ishuz.

S.FORM: pizaiza s mihu a qamishan thuini?
iaku thuini a kawash makthin a qamishan.
pizaiza s thithu a qamishan thuini?
thithu thuini a kawash makthin tusha wa qamishan.
pizaiza s mihu a ama wa qamishan thuini?
naak a ama thuini a kawash marimaz a qamishan.
lapiza s mihu a minlhafut?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: itia naak a latusha tantuqash a minlhafut numa itia latata shashuazi a minlhafut.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: itia mihu a tantuqash ayuzi a minlhafut?
ani, uka sa naak a tantuqash a ayuzi.
S.TRANSL: No, I don't have a brother.

S.FORM: lapiza wa thau maniun tata wa taun?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: iamin tata wa taun lashpaat a thau.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: intua s ihu ya malhupish?
itusi iaku Shtafari lhmupish.
S.TRANSL: I study at a head society.

S.FORM: tima thithu?
naak a pan’amaan thithu.
numa s palhkakrikriw mihu a pan’amaan?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: maranash thithu.
tima s huya wa thau?
naak a tantuqash binanau’az a minlhafut thithu.
itia palhkakrikriw mihu a tantuqash binanau’az a minlhafut?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: itusi thithu mriqariqaz shiz a taun malhkakrikriw.
minlhafut thaithuy qa latusha wa thau?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: ani, huruy thaithuy.
miniahala inai a thau ihu?
ua, Thau iaku.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I'm from the Thao tribe.

S.FORM: miniahala inai a thau mihu a binanau’az qa?
ua, kanuiza Bunuun thithu.
marutaw mihu a ama qa?
ua, marutarutaw naak a tata wa taun a thau.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: mihu a shashuazi binanau’az a minlhafut lhmupishiza thithu qa?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: ua, lhmupishiza thithu.
mafazaq malhinuna Thau a lalawa qa mihu a shashuazi a minlhafut?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: ua, mafazaq thaithuy malhinuna Thau a lalawa.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: lapiza s mihu a minlhafut?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: itia naak a minlhafut laturu.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: miasuun uhu mihu a ama ina qa?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: ua, miasuun iaku naak a ama ina.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: miasuun uhu mihu a apura’in apuki’ay qa?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: ani, ani iaku tu miasuun thaithuy.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn't live with them.

S.FORM: tima s usuunan uhu?
miasuun iaku naak a ama ina numa tantuqash ayuzi a minlhafut.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: minakanantua ihu?
minakatusi iaku Baraubaw makunanai.
S.TRANSL: I come from the tribe of Idashor.

S.FORM: intua s maniun a taun?
isai Baraubaw naam a taun.
S.TRANSL: 我們的家在伊達邵部落
Our home is in the Idaho tribe.

S.FORM: intua s mihu a kataunan?
naak a kataunan itusi Zintun.
S.TRANSL: My hometown is in Sun Moon Lake.

S.FORM: intua s maniun a kataunan?
itusi Baraubaw naam a kataunan.
alhakaiza ihu mushuqish mihu a kataunan?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: miaqay iaku mutaun ya pinangqaiza mahnariza wa qali.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: Thau a azazak iaku.
maqitan thuini a qali qa?
mu’apawiza sa tilhaz, mathuaw mahnar sa qali.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: mathuaw mashimzaw isaran qa?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: mathuaw mashimzaw, apashinasha sa hulus.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: mathuaw mahnar isaran qa?
ani, minfariza, mathuaw mahaziwhiw.
maqitan thuini a qali qa?
dara wa mahnar thuini a qali, mathuaw tauduu.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: maqitan sa thuini a tanlhuan a qali qa?
qali uka sa urum, mu’apawiza sa kilhpuz.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: maqitan ya isaran a qali qa?
mukaktuniza qmusaz, mu’apawiza sa tilhaz numa mu’apawiza mani sa qariwazwaz.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: miakuza maniun a qali itantu?
S.TRANSL: What's the weather like where you are?

S.FORM: inai iamin mathuaw mara’in a fari.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: miakuza maniun a qali itantu?
mathuaw maqitan, mathuaw matata wa tilhaz.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: amutusi iaku malhupish.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: qali mathuaw mashimzaw, apashinasha sa hulus.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: amusaran iaku.
a’untarawin sa qusaz ya ikahi, ata ihu tu in’aura kathu sa pashikan.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，不要忘記帶雨傘。
It's going to rain heavily, don't forget to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: aqmusaz qa?
tminubarumbuniza tu ikahi, amaqusaz painan ya ikahi.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下可能就會下雨。
It just thundered, and it might rain later.

S.FORM: qusaziniza?
qminusaz tu ikahi, pangqaiza qusaz thuini.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: qusaziniza?
qminusaz painan tu ikahi, matubu sa saran.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: qusaziniza? minu matubuiza sa mihu a buut?
S.TRANSL: 在下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: qusazin isaran, ani iaku tu kminathu s pashikan.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: maqitan ihu qa?
mathuaw mara’in sa fari numa naak a punuq infarin mathuaw makashpar.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: maqitan ihu qa?
mathuaw mahaha sa tilhaz numa naak a punuq patilhazin mathuaw mingqaqarimuzmuz.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: min’aura iaku kmathu sa patatash.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: pashimul iaku ihun.
min’aura iaku kmathu sa kakthi.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: min’aura iaku mani kmathu sa kakthi, usha ita fariw.
S.TRANSL: 我也忘記帶筷子，我們去買。
I also forgot to bring my chopsticks, let's go buy them.

S.FORM: ushaiza ita fariw patatash?
S.TRANSL: Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: ua, afariw iaku tatitish mani.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: izau! fariw ita kunshashanu a akaanin?
S.TRANSL: 來吧!我們去買早餐好嗎?
Come on! Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: ani, kminaaniza iaku itaun.
S.TRANSL: No, I've already eaten at home.

S.FORM: min’aura iaku pishtata sa pinuqafay.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to heat up my lunchbox.

S.FORM: uhiaw pishtata!
min’aura iaku kmathu sa pinuqafay.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: kunsuun ita kmaan sa naak a pinuqafay!
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: numa sa akaanin uhu ya saqazi?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: amakaan iaku lhupilhupishan a taun a kunsaqazi a akaanin.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: numa sa akaanin uhu ya saqazi?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: thuini iaku kminathu sa pinuqafay, kunsuun ita saqazi kmaan.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

S.FORM: izau! ushaiza ita matinhina sa qarimusuz?
S.TRANSL: 來吧!我們去玩籃球好嗎?
Come on! Let's go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: ua! paza ita.
izau! ushaiza ita matinhina sa paru sa qarimusuz?
ani, amalhupish iaku patashan.
arawan uhu sa thathapu lhai iakin.
ua, haya wa thathapu lhai ihun.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: arawan uhu sa tatitish lhai iakin?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: mathapu iaku bukhaz, palalawan uhu Tuba mara sa tatitish.
S.TRANSL: 我在掃地，你叫Tuba幫你拿布。
I was sweeping the floor and you asked Tuba to help you with the cloth.

S.FORM: thminapuiza ihu taun a bukhaz?
S.TRANSL: Have you finished sweeping the floor?

S.FORM: thminapuiza iaku.
minu ihu qa antu mathapu sa bukhaz.
thminapuiza iaku.
bukhaz antu matilaw, titishiwan uhu!
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: ua, amara iaku tatitish.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: mathuaw maradaradaq huya wa paziwat, titishiwan uhu!
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: italhawan, inai niwan iaku tu ukaktunin mathapu.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.

S.FORM: amuntua ihu ya ikahi?
amakilhim iaku sa fuifuilh patashan a shinshii.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: amuntua ihu ya pangqaiza lhmupish?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: amususuun iaku naak a huruy maqaquyash.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: amuntua thithu ya pangqaiza lhmupish?
S.TRANSL: Where does he go after school?

S.FORM: amutusi mrauz thithu.
itia Tumi itaun?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Tumi is home?

S.FORM: ua, itaun thithu, utaunuan.
S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: itia Tumi itaun?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Tumi is home? *[Lisin] Please change the name to an ethnic woman.

S.FORM: uka thithu itaun, numa sa akalawan uhu qa?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She's not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: tima?
apura’in, iaku Puni, tanaiwan sa pitaw.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I'm Puni, please open the door.

S.FORM: tima?
Apin, Sihaw iaku, kilhim iaku ihun amapalhalhiqash.
S.TRANSL: Apin, I'm Sihaw, I've come to play with you. *[Kacaw][Mayaw] Please change the names of the women of each tribe.

S.FORM: mathuaw mataliza antu mriqaz.
ua, mathuaw iaku mangqtuqtu ihun. iahiaw mutaun mapalhinuna!
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!

S.FORM: ilhungquan, iqilhawan pushawil.
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: anuniza.
iqilhawan pushawil.
uau~ mathuaw maniun a pushawil makanshuz maqitan iqilhaan.
kaanuan ita ribush a bunlhaz!
ua! haya wa ribush a bunlhaz mathuaw tauduu ya riqazan.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: maqitan kaanin qa ribush a bunlhaz?
ua, dadu mathuaw maqitan kaanin.
pinintataiza ina kuntanlhuan a pania’an iahiaw munai kmaan!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: ua, shinawakuan naak a rima.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: kaanuan! ata tu kayaw! antu ihu sa shahitan.
S.TRANSL: 吃吧! 不要害羞! 你不是外人。
Eat! Don't be shy! You're not an outsider.

S.FORM: kunthuaw kmaan iaku, mathuaw mabuqthiwiza.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I'm full.

S.FORM: kaanuan! ata tu kayaw!
ua, mathuaw maqitan kaanin.
amushaiza iaku, uqthawan mapariqaz.
S.TRANSL: I have to leave now, see you next time.

S.FORM: ua, uqthawan mapariqaz.
mathuaw mahumhumiza, amutauniza iaku.
uqthawan munai malhalhiqash!
undaudauk mundadaan!
ua, unaiwan ihu naak a taun kilhnaqualh ya ishawanan.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: pashtay piakalingkin piakaimahan, palhintal ita thuini musui kataunan makikalhi apu numanuma.
S.TRANSL: 大家健康平安，今天我們要一起去部落訪問耆老。
Good health and peace to all, today we will go to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: ua! amashthau a lalawa iamin mat apu.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說邵語。

S.FORM: ashaunatantuiza ita?
ashauna’iutuiza.
apu Kilash, itiza iamin munai mriqaz ihun.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa Kilash, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: ba, mafazaq maniun mashthau! mathuaw maqitan!
S.TRANSL: 你們會說邵語啊!真是太棒了!
You guys speak Thau! That’s great!

S.FORM: pashtay piakalingkin piakaimahan, palhintal ita thuini musui tamakuan mubuhat.
S.TRANSL: 大家健康平安，今天我們要一起去去菜園工作。
Be healthy and safe everyone, today we are going to work in the vegetable garden together.

S.FORM: ua, shinshii.
pashtay uniawan ududur, ata tu in’aura kmathu sa ubuhat a aniamin.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: ua, shinshii, kminathu iamin az’az a ubuhat a aniamin.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: a’itiza ita?
niwan, ihazishuan.
S.TRANSL: Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: ushawan uhu shmansazum.
ua, shmansazum iaku.
ushaiza ihu mara sa rumfaz a madanshir.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: ua, amashashaw iaku rumfaz.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: pashtay piakalingkin piakaimahan, amutusi ita thuini ia’ianan numanuma wa lhkaribush a luluuman.
S.TRANSL: 大家健康平安，我們今天要去動物園。
Be healthy and safe, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: mathuaw maqitan! amiakuza ita ya mutantu?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: milhungqu ita ba-su mutantu.
pashtay ududur, afariw ita sa qahil.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們要買票了。
Everyone line up, we need to buy tickets now.

S.FORM: ua.
rumfaz itanamuqtha numa qlhuran itanarikus, shanamaniun mriqaz.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: shinshii, shungkash iaku qlhuran.
ata tu shkash, ushaiza ihu riqazuan sa rumfaz.
S.TRANSL: Don’t be afraid, then you go and see the birds.

S.FORM: ya tata wa tilhaz amushuqish ita muriut miasuun.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: ua, anuniza shinshii.
numa sa minriqaz ihu qa thuini?
minriqaz iaku sa manasha wa qlhuran numa itiawan sa manasha wa rumfaz.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.

S.FORM: iahiaw, amushaiza ita.
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: italhawan iakin, mathuaw mingkashlay naak a kuskus.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: palhintaz ita utusiwan wazaqan mrauz?
S.TRANSL: 我們一起去潭那邊游泳好嗎?
Shall we go swimming at the pool together?

S.FORM: ua! paza!
mathuaw inai manasha wa thau mrauz.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: mathuaw maruqruq imangkathi kinai ita mrauz shduuiza.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: miakuza ihu tu makunanai?
mundadaan iaku makunanai.
numa wa barimbin ilhungquan uhu munai?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: milhungqu iaku sa ba-su makunanai.

S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: patungbarimbin iaku ya mutusi balinuqaz a taun, maqa patungbarimbin maqitan ya mat milhungqu sa basu a barimbin.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: farifariwan makitqualh sa mihu a taun qa?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: antu iqualh, matung’u-tu-bai iaku ya mutantu farifariwan.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: yu-kiuq makitqualh sa lhupilhupishan a taun qa?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: iqualh, ya mundadaan ashaunatantuiza.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: kmaan afu a taun makitqualh sa ia’ianan milhungqu a barimbin a taun qa?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: ya mu’apaw sa ia’ianan milhungqu a barimbin a taun uqthawan mundadaan larima wa qumbu ashaunatantuiza.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: ishawanan uhu thuini?
minu qa?
amusui iaku mriqaz ihun.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: thuini iaku uka shawan numawan uka itaun. suma wa qali shduuiza.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家。改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: ishawanan uhu ya simaq? amakilhim iaku ihun ya saqaziza.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: shduu, itaun iaku mitalha ihun.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: makikalhiwan qazii ya shduu aru-iin iaku ihun? maqa amatqal iaku.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: ua! pusa anunin.
shduu ya pulaunin sa bahi?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: ani iaku tu min’miaqitan ya riqazan, numa talhuqan mani antu pinaqitan, ani.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: muqayiza iaku pashtiruq.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: ata mani tu pashtiruq.
anuniza ihun pakikalhiak.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: anunin qa, numa sa amakikalhiwan uhu?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: makikalhiwan iaku ihun ya parhawayuan numa sa kalawan uhu?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: kahiwan iaku minmaranash, numa iaku pangqaiza thuini.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: itia sa palhkakrikriw ihu thuini?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: itusi iaku lhupilhupishan a taun malhkakrikriw.
makikalhiwan iaku ihun mihu a azazak itusi kataunan mani qa?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: uka, naak a azazak itusi mawalhnaq a pruq.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: kamamuri ihu lhkananai?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: hmadana iaku itiawan latata wa atu numa latata wa rumfaz, thaithuy mani sa naak a taun a thau.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: hmadana iaku latata wa qaruta mani, ianan sa lhkaribush miasuun amaqa antu inawawaaz.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: makikalhiwan iaku ihun numanuma wa muribush a parshian.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: daza iaku mafazaq, ya mafazaq iaku afuilh ihun.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: numa wa parshian maniun ya muribush a aniamin?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: naam a muribush a aniamin antu shduu pashuzap sa binanau’az.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: shduu binanau’az musuun mutusi muribush?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: ani, antu binanau’az mani ya muntal muribush.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Qabus, ukaiza itaun zashuq a qilha, ushaiza ihu fariw.
S.TRANSL: Qabus，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Qabus, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: sua-kaa itiawan tata pan, ingqaiza tu afariw.
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧。
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: antu shduu tata pan, uqthawan fariw tusha pan.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: afariw iaku zashuq a qilha, itia maniun ya fariwin?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: itia! lapiza wa afariwin uhu?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: afariw iaku tusha pan, numa afariw tata pinutiqu a zashuq.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: zashuq inai, numa sa uqthawan afariwin uhu?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: amuqthawan fariw iaku qarithuy, itia maniun qa?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: naam a qarithuy ulhthkizin suma wa finariw.
afariw iaku sa hulus.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: amiakuza s hulus ushnawin uhu?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: afariw iaku luish a rima wa hulus.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: qazii ya miakuza s izai maqulhaqulha?
qazii ya itiawan suma wa kinasia?
iamin itiawan sa mapuzipuzi numa madishlum.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: ananaiwan iakin tata wa madishlum a hulus.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Qabus shintua ihu tu ikahi? shitusi ihu pinkazakaza sa buut?
S.TRANSL: Qabus你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Qabus, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ani, shitusi iaku mindahip apuki’ay fariwin sa shanglaw.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: ihu ya ishawanan ya mahumhum? qazii ya mat iakin kmaan afu.
S.TRANSL: 你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: ani, amutusiwak fariw sa hulus.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: muntal iaku ihun.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: maqitan ihu, lakuza wa tuali haya wa finutulh a shanglaw.
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: tata wa finutulh a shanglaw mapushaz sui.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: lakuza wa tuali haya wa buna?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: tata tingting a buna maturuz sui.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: ananaiwan iakin tusha finutulh a shanglaw numa tata tingting a buna.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Tuba, min’aura iaku kminathu sa patatash, shduu ihu shimulikuan?
S.TRANSL: Tuba，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Tuba, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: uka iaku mani, ti Shuni izai.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Shuni’s.

S.FORM: shduu ya shimulikuan? muhiaw iaku pushuqishin uhu.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: ua, arahu.
anuniza, anuniza Shuni mani.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Shuni for me.

S.FORM: numa sa amindahipuan uhu?
apushuqishin iaku sa izai a latusha wa patashan.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: ua, itiawan amindahipuan uhu?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: amuqthawan iaku shmimul laturu a patashan.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: shduuiza, ata tu in’auraan ya turuiza wa qali apushuqishin.
S.TRANSL: 好了，記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: niwan ihu tu pushuqishin iakin tatitish.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: pinushuqishiza iaku ihun tilha.
minuiza naak a tatitish makauka.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: qazii ihu ya pashimul Tuba?
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Tuba?

S.FORM: tihawta iaku, pakikalhiwan iaku thithu.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: mihala iaku shimulin naak a tatitish ihun.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Shuni, izai a maka’apaw a hulus sa Tuba wa shimulin uhu?
S.TRANSL: Shuni, did Tuba lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ani, haya naak a ina finariw lhai iakin.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: Tuba wa maka’apaw a hulus tataal mihu.
S.TRANSL: Tuba’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: thithu a maka’apaw a hulus maqusuqusum, antu tataal iamin.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們顏色不一樣。
’s coat is thHis coat is black, so our colors are different.e same as yours.

S.FORM: Shuni, shinimul ihu sa Hudun a tuali?
S.TRANSL: Shuni, did you borrow money from Hudun?

S.FORM: ua, naur thuini iaku mriri thithu, min’aura iaku makathu sa tuali.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: alhakaiza ya pushuqishin uhu?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: pushuqishin iaku thithu ya simaq.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: ua, afuilh iaku Hudun.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Hudun for you.

S.FORM: ya smapuk sa mashmash apasain sa qadup, numa ya smapuk sa tikulhath apasain sa mahaqu, ya miazithu mubalabalay.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: naur ya miazithu, muririw tu suma iaku, amaqa iaku antu mara.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: pinfazaq iaku ihun amiakuza kmalawa s izai latusha wa tuqris.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: ua! maqitan, ya miazithu shduu iaku mara sa lhkaribush ya kahiza.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: buhat a lhmir mathuaw marutawiza, usuiwan uhu thapa mara sa kaklhit, amutusi ita buhat.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: pintuan sa kaklhit?
isai lhalhahi a shirshir, makuntantu ihu thapa ashaqtuniza.
S.TRANSL: 在背簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
Beside the back basket, you will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: inanuru ya mara ata tu klhitin, mathuaw kaklhit malamlam.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿不要割到，鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: ata tu kangqthaan naak a tuqris.
intua s mihu a tuqris?
naak a tuqris isai huya wa ribush a bangqir.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: minu ihu qa mangqtuqtu?
pinataqal iaku izai, mafazaq iaku naak a tuqris ya intua.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: haya wa lhalhuzu, pulhalhuzu iamin falhaza wa shirshir smapuk sa rusaw.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: uka iamin lhalhuzu, pasain iamin paniza ya maniza sa rusaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: iaku antu pinasa paniza, shduu ihu suma wa qali pinfazaq iakin?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你改天教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: ua! suma wa qali apalhintaz ita musui maniza sa rusaw.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們改天一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: ya suma wa qali apinfazaq iaku ihun kmalawa sa lhalhuzu.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: makakakri mihu a paniza, qazii ya mupaniza sa rusaw, iahiaw shmuruz ihu.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: italhawan, ma’a’a’inur sa ruza, inai iaku shmuruz sa paniza, utusiwan uhu mara sa dawaz.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: shuruz ihu sa rusaw pakunanai, shuruzikuan sa rusaw.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊，我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: mathuaw maqitan! u’araan manasha sa rusaw thuini, mathuaw mapunishiza luluman sa rusaw.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: iahiaw mutaun ita mashtay kungqruman.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: itiza fuifuilh patashan a shinshii munai.
ingqaiza malhalhiqash, iahiaw ushai mihu a pangka milhungqu.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: amazaiza, saqazian iaku munai!
iahiaw mutaun.
ripay piza thuini?
ripay rima thuini, pangqaiza simaq, musuun ita kilhnaqualh!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: ua! musuun ita mutusi falhaza.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: ripay piza simaq?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: ripay turu simaq, musuun ita matinhina sa maqarimusuz ya simaq saqazi!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: numa s kalawan uhu simaq a shashanu?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: amuntal iaku naak a ina, mutusi balinuqaz a taun.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: minu ihu qa?
miku’utaq iaku, amutusi iaku puthaqian.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: minqaqarimuzmuz naak a punuq.
pangqawan uhu isaiwan pangka matikmuthmuth.
shinshii, makashpar naak a tiaz, amutusiwak puthaqian.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: ua, iahiaw mutantu.
qazii iaku musui mashinaw rima qa?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: apangqaiza, shana ikahi mutantu.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: shinshii, mathuaw makashpar naak a punuq, apangqawak ya saqazi.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: ua, ata iaramaz ya mutaun.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: shinshii, apangqawak ya ripay tata, maqa amariqaz iaku mriqariqaz shiz a shinshii.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: ua, piakakalinkin s mihu a buut.
intua sa Apin?
makashpar thithu tiaz, itusi thithu sa puthaqian.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: intua sa Shuhut？
shinshii, makashpar Shuhut a lahulahu, pangqa thuini.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Shuhut has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: minu qa Apin uka munai?
matata dai thithu a buut.
in’ananak uhu mzai mihu a numanuma.
naak a lhanaz zain Qaba Lhkapamumu, iaku thuini makthin a qamishan.
S.TRANSL: My name is Qaba Lhkapamumu, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: kuzan mihu a lhanaz?
naak a lhanaz zain Qaba Lhkapamumu.
lhkanantua wa azazak ihu?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: tu Thau a azazak iaku.
mihu a taun az’az miniahala inai a thau qa?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ua, iamin tata taun az’az Thau.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是邵族人。
Yes, my whole family is Thau.

S.FORM: mihu a taun az’az miniahala inai a thau qa?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ani, tu Thau naak a ama, numa Shpuut naak a ina.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是邵族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Thau, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: manu a azazak ihu?
Paruqatash Lhkapamumu a azazak iaku.
huya mihu a ama qa? pizaiza thithu a qamishan?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: makalhturuturuiza makthin thithu a qamishan.
huya mihu a ama qa? pizaiza thithu a qamishan?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: ani, naam a kataunan a tanatuqash, makashpashpatiza makthin thithu a qamishan.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: pizaiza s mihu a tantuqash ayuzi a minlhafut a qamishan?
makthin makashpashpat naak a tantuqash ayuzi a minlhafut a qamishan.
mihu a tantuqash ayuzi a minlhafut manasha qamishan mat ihu qa?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: shantaan iakin larima wa qamishan.
lakuza ihu rutaw?
tata shaba mashpatiz shian a rutaw iaku.
mindaaq iaku antu mriqaz ihun, minrutawiza ihu qa?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: ua, tata shaba maturuziza shian a rutaw iaku.
minramuiza ihu qa?
ani, muririw ihu mriqaz.
minshiqarmaniza ihu qa?
ani, minramuiza iaku.
minramuiza ihu qa?
ua, maturuziza iaku qung tingting thuini.
amuntua ihu?
amutusi iaku palhkakrikriw a ianan makilhim iaku fuifuilh patashan a shinshii.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: amuntua Quan?
amutusi thithu qmauriwa sa bzu.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: intua sa Quan?
itusi thithu mrauz a pruq, amalantatnur thithu mrauz ya ikahi.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: intua sa Ilun? amalantatnur thithu malalia ya ikahi.
S.TRANSL: Ilun在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Ilun? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: itusi thithu palhkakrikriw a ianan, amutantu iaku malalawa.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: palhintal ita mutantu makakakri a danshiqan.
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: amihala iaku fariw sa kunsaqazi a akaanin, amutantu iaku makilhim ihu ya ikahi.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: izau usuun ita mungqibi sa pinuqafay!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: kilhimuan uhu suma, amutusi iaku makilhim fuifuilh patashan a shinshii.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: amalantatnur Quan malalia thuini qa?
S.TRANSL: Is Quan competing in running today?

S.FORM: ani, amalantatnur thithu minparaw.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: amalantatnur ihu numanuma qa ya amalantatnur numanuma wa qali?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ua, amalantatnur iaku malalia.
amalantatnur ihu numanuma qa ya amalantatnur numanuma wa qali?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: amalantatnur iaku minparaw.
numa s kalawan ita ya amalantatnur numanuma wa qali?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: amalantatnur ita mapashashuruz faa.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: afariwin suma ita akaanin ya amalantatnur numanuma wa qali qa?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: ani, afariwin suma ita marfazfaz a maqarimusuz.
mathuaw ihu matunaw, mathuaw ma’ania!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: anuniza.
itia mihu a apuki’ay itaun?
itia, isa ianan thithu malhus.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: itia mihu a apuki’ay itaun?
uka itaun, musaran thithu tu ikahi, amutaun thithu ya tanlhuan.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: itia mihu a apura’in itaun?
isui makinpushaz a taun thithu, anasaya ihu makinpushaz a taun kmilhim thithu.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: itia thau itaun?
ba! Malihan, mathuaw mataliza antu mriqaz ihun, maqitan ihu qa?
S.TRANSL: 是Malihan阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Malihan. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: maqitan! amakilhim iaku ihun amalhalhinunawan.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: intua s mihu a ama?
isa ainuz kmal’in thithu sa pania’an, apalalawak.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: muntua sa Anai?
mutusi thithu qalhufu smapuk sa ranaw.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: apura’in, itiza iamin munai.
uka maniun a apura’in itaun, isai buhat thithu, itaun maniun mitalha thithu.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: ama Tuba itiza ihu munai!
mathuaw mataliza antu mriqaz ihun, minmarutawiza ihu.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: mathuaw maqaran naak a shnaw ya mriqaz ihun.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: haya wa ung-lai pansha maniun, apisai matithi a kakadu.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: mindaaqiza antu shinai, amalalawa iaku thaithuy pashtay mulhthkiz munai makaan.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: ingqaiza uka shawashawan, uqay iaku miqilha pushawil, usui ita maharan a bukhaz malhalhinuna.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: anuniza! ingqaiza uka shawashawan, amutaun iaku.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: kinapathay iaku haya ranaw, kathuiza ihu manataun makaan.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: qazii ya simaq a saqazi mapariqaz ita?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: ua, a’intua ita amapariqaz?
isui ita lhupilhupishan a taun mitalha? apashtiruq iamin.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: usui ita talhuqan mitalha maqitan, a’ifazin Thau a hulus iaku mutantu.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: mathuaw lamaqitan iamin a sa-ku-laa ya makabukay. ya makabukay unai ihu makilhim iakin.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: ashaunatusiza puhubuqiza wa qali, mathuaw mindaaq!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: qazii ya Tungkariri Lus’an ihu munai!
S.TRANSL: 那你祖靈祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Tungkariri Lus’an!

S.FORM: ua! miku’utantu iaku!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: minu ihu qa amushuqish kataunan?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: maqa amutaun iaku fuifuilh patashan.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: minu ihu qa antu itusi mawalhnaq a pruq fuifuilh patashan?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: maqa mangqtu iaku naak a kataunan a pruq, numa miku iaku lhungqizi kataunan a thau.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: mathuaw ma’ania ihu tunuun, tima fuilh ihun?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: naak a apuki’ay, lamathuaw thithu ma’ania tunuun maqusum a tanatuqash isa naam a kataunan.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: minu ihu qa amangqtu minfazaq tunuun sa maqusum?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: maqa tunuun sa maqusum mita wa kazakazash, mangqtu iaku izai a kazakazash ata pu’ukai.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: haya sunda wa qilha mathuaw maqitan ya qilhan.
iaku min’ananak pinqilha!
mathuaw ma’ania ihu, amindaaq ya kmalawa haya qilha?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: antu mindaaq, tata wa ripay painan aminqilhaiza. pintatan sunda wa zashuq masa kamar, numa pahiburan sa bulbul, numa ribuqin pisai qatapay, numa pusai sa tahamish.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和小米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: numa s ihu farifariwin aniamin?
itia haya makamun numa tilkun, iaku min’ananak malhuiza!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: lakuza wa tuali haya latusha afariwik?
mulhthkiz lhupishin tusha shaba ianan larima makthin a sui.
mushnaw iaku haya hulus, lapiza wa tuali?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: haya latata larima shaba wa sui.
mathuaw maklis, qazii ya put’ladadu?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: ata, ya ladadu pungqalath iaku sa tuali.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: shduu! afariw iaku latata maqusuqusum a hulus.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: afariw iaku haya funush numa qashay.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: mulhthkiz lhupishin latusha matilatilaw a sui, haya funush numa qashay min’ananak iaku kmalawa, amathuaw mindaaq maqitan kinalawa.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: amalalawa iaku naak a huruy munai fariw, put’ladaduan dai?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: shduu! put’ladaduan ladadu.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a discount.

S.FORM: izau unai mariqazuan! farifariw hulus numa tamuhun!
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: lapiza wa tuali haya wa hulus?
haya latata hulus turu shaba ianan marimaz a sui, numa ya laturu shduuiza tata matilatilaw a sui.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: amuqay iaku fariw latata, anai faqlhu a hulus
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: maqitan ihu, afariw iaku sunda wa afu numa qana.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和刺蔥芋莖腸。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: mulhthkizin fariwiniza s afu ukaiza. itia tatanaq a qmu, afariw ihu?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥麻糬，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana mochi, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: ua! fariw iaku tata, amuqthaiza iaku munai fariw afu.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: ua, apasain qahil iaku putiqu lhai ihun, haya marimaz a sui.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
